PAGE.TITLE: Markovian transition matrix
PAGE.DESCRIPTION:
The transition matrix for a Markov chain with $n$ states is an $n\times n$ square matrix in which the $i,j$ element gives you
the conditional probability of being in state $j$ at time $t+1$ if you are in state $i$ at time $t$.

UL.LI: You should be able to interpret the elements of the transition probability matrix by making reference to the Markov property.
You should be able to extract transition probabilities between states from the transition probability matrix.
You should be able to draw the transition graph when given the transition probability matrix.
You should be able to write out the transition proability matrix when given the transition graph.
